an5.155:0.3: 155. The Decline of the True Teaching (2nd)
an5.155:1.1: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:1.3: It’s when the mendicants don’t memorize the teaching—
an5.155:1.4: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
an5.155:1.5: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:2.1: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:3.1: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:4.1: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:5.1: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:5.2: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:5.3: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
an5.155:6.1: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
an5.155:6.3: It’s when the mendicants memorize the teaching—
an5.155:6.4: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
an5.155:6.5: This is the first thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
an5.155:7.1: Furthermore, the mendicants explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:8.1: Furthermore, the mendicants make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:9.1: Furthermore, the mendicants recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:10.1: Furthermore, the mendicants think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.
an5.155:10.2: This is the fifth thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
an5.155:10.3: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
